thread.title: Flagship Xiaomi Mi6 may sport 2.7GHz octa-core CPU and 6GB of RAM
thread.title_full: Flagship Xiaomi Mi6 may sport 2.7GHz octa-core CPU and 6GB of RAM

author: Josh Levenson
title: Flagship Xiaomi Mi6 may sport 2.7GHz octa-core CPU and 6GB of RAM
text:
Later this year, Xiaomi is expected to launch its flagship smartphone of 2017, the Mi6, and now thanks to a leaked screenshot, it looks like we have some more information about its specifications.
See full gallery on TechnoBuffalo.com The image, which was uploaded to Chinese social networking website Weibo, reveals that the handset may sport a 2.7GHz octa-core CPU, 6GB of RAM and 256GB of internal storage. It could also ship running Android 7.0 Nougat.
Recent rumors point towards Xiaomi releasing three variants — Lite, Regular and Premium — of the Mi6, leading us to suspect that this screenshot pertains to the latter, which is said to have a ceramic body and be powered by a Snapdragon 835 processor.
Whereas, the Lite and Regular models are believed to pack a Snapdragon 821 and a MediaTek Helio X30 CPU, respectively. In addition, both may sport 4GB of RAM and have a dual rear-facing camera configuration.
Relatively easy to falsify However, it should go without saying that screenshots, like the one we’re seeing today, are relatively easy to falsify — so this latest leak needs to be taken with a considerable… Actually, scrap that. Hefty pinch of salt.
